a management restructure involving long-time chief executive Eric Schmidt becoming executive chairman. Eric Schmidt , who has led Google since 2001, will take on the new role on April 4, working mostly on external operations, including deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership . As Google's new chief executive, Larry Page will lead product development and technology strategy, along with all day-to-day operations of the firm. Though viewed by many as the spear of Mr. George H. W. Bush 's "freedom agenda," Mr. Donald Rumsfeld also expresses misgivings about "nation-building." He disagrees with the "Pottery Barn rule" - attributed to Mr. Colin Powell-that if you break it, you own it, arguing Iraq was already broken under Saddam. While he acknowledges that the U.S. had security obligations to Iraq, he expresses discomfort with Mr. George H. W.
